headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Dr. Hunter on the Care of Pulmonary Consumption. Robbing a Railroad Depot.

docs.lead_paragraph: Robbing a Railroad Depot. On Thursday morning Sergt. MARTIN and Officer Ross, of the Jefferson Police Court, arrested two night watchmen of the New-York and New-Haven Railroad, named GEORGE AMES and JOHN WATERS, charged with committing numerous robberies at the canal-street Depot.
docs.snippet: Robbing a Railroad Depot. On Thursday morning Sergt. MARTIN and Officer Ross, of the Jefferson Police Court, arrested two night watchmen of the New-York and New-Haven Railroad, named GEORGE AMES and JOHN WATERS, charged with committing numerous...

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE ST. LOUIS FROM HAVRE; Opinions of the British Press on Enlisting Men in the United States. GEN. CANROBERT'S DISPATCH. RECEPTION OF THE MAILS. THE FRENCH WAR STATEMENT, OFFICIAL And of the Africa at Boston.

NEW-YORK CITY.; COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER. Termination of the Jury Cases for the April Term. Cases of Schaffenberg and Eberly--Discharge Edward Allen. Discharge of Edward Allen for the Murder of Patrick Quinn by a Knife. Sentence on Peter M. Lawson--The Dey-street Murder--Sentence on Carnell. Fire Marshal's Investigation--Attempt to Burn the St. Louis Hotel--Arrest on Suspicionof Arson--Remarkable Developments attending the Case. LAW INTELLIGENCE. The Great Oar Wheel Patent Case. UNITED STATES MARSHAL'S OFFICE. SUPREME COURT--CIRCUIT. SUPERIOR COURT--TRIAL TERM.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the opening of the Court this morning, Mr. Clinton handed an affidavit to the Court asking for a mitigation of punishment in the case of Peter Lawson. Edward Allen, the boy who was indicted for the murder of Patrick Quinn by a knife, on the 5th of November last, and who pleaded guilty of manslaughter in the fourth degree, was then called up for sentence.

headline.main: HAVANA MATTERS.; LETTER FROM DR. PECK. STATEMENT OF MR. THOMOSON. General Abuse of Americans in Cuba. To the Editor of the New-Orleans Picayune. LETTER FROM DR. CHARLES A. PECK.

docs.lead_paragraph: Having just reached New-Orleans, after my re. lease, or rather my escape from the clutches of Spanish terrorism in Cuba, permit me to make known, through your columns, the treatment to which 1, an American citizen, have been subjected.
docs.abstract: Position of Americans in Havana - Case of Dr. Chas. Peck.
docs.snippet: Having just reached New-Orleans, after my re. lease, or rather my escape from the clutches of Spanish terrorism in Cuba, permit me to make known, through your columns, the treatment to which 1, an American citizen, have been subjected.

docs.lead_paragraph: We publish, this morning, a highly interesting letter from Dr. CHAS. A. PICK, detailing in graphic language his recent experience of life in Cuba, and the circumstances attending his arrest and imprisonment by the Spanish authorities in that island. We commend it to the thoughtful attention of our readers.
docs.snippet: We publish, this morning, a highly interesting letter from Dr. CHAS. A. PICK, detailing in graphic language his recent experience of life in Cuba, and the circumstances attending his arrest and imprisonment by the Spanish authorities in that island....
